todaysEvents.title: €700M Deepfake Crypto Scam Network Dismantled
todaysEvents.description: Law enforcement has dismantled a €700M deepfake crypto scam network that used deepfakes and other malicious tactics to trick thousands into fake investments and money laundering.

todaysEvents.title: 'GeminiJack' 0-Click Flaw in Gemini AI Reported
todaysEvents.description: A new 'GeminiJack' 0-Click flaw in Gemini AI has been reported, potentially exposing users to data leaks through poisoned files that could trigger access to Gmail, Docs, and Calendar data.

todaysEvents.title: Telegram Scam with Altered Profiles
todaysEvents.description: Users on Telegram are reporting a scam involving altered profiles and identical text.

todaysEvents.title: Telegram Vector Attack and Scammer Reported
todaysEvents.description: Users on Telegram are reporting a vector attack and referring to a scammer.

todaysEvents.title: Increase in Scammers on Telegram Channel
todaysEvents.description: Users on Telegram reported an increase in scammers on the channel.

todaysEvents.title: Scammers Encountered on Telegram Channels
todaysEvents.description: Users on Telegram channels reported encountering scammers.

past7Days.briefing: This week witnessed a marked escalation in cyber threats, with several high-impact incidents striking financial institutions, healthcare, manufacturing, and crypto sectors. Notably, critical ransomware breaches affected over 70 banks and a major NHS trust, exposing hundreds of thousands of individuals. The DeFi space suffered a $9M exploit, while the manufacturing sector saw a massive data exfiltration targeting BMW, Nissan, and Scania. Law enforcement dismantled a €700M deepfake crypto scam network, and a severe zero-click vulnerability ('GeminiJack') in Gemini AI was disclosed, exposing Google user data to risk. Social engineering and scam activity surged on Telegram channels, underlining heightened fraud and phishing risks. The convergence of ransomware, sophisticated exploits, and deepfake-enabled scams signals an increasingly complex, multi-vector threat landscape.
past7Days.trends: Key trends include a spike in ransomware and data breach activity, particularly via third-party and software vulnerabilities impacting financial and healthcare sectors. Surveillance and AI technologies emerged as new threat vectors, with Intellexa spyware and Gemini AI vulnerabilities indicating increased targeting of advanced systems. Deepfake-powered scams and social engineering attacks proliferated, notably on popular messaging platforms like Telegram. There is a notable rise in user-reported scams, fraud, and authentication compromise in crypto and fintech communities. The week also saw a pattern of high-severity incidents clustered around mid-week, suggesting adversaries may be timing attacks for maximum disruption.
past7Days.predictions: Expect continued targeting of financial, healthcare, and manufacturing organizations through ransomware and sophisticated exploit techniques, with third-party vendor risks remaining elevated. AI and surveillance platforms will likely attract further attention from threat actors, especially as zero-click and deepfake methods become more widespread. Social engineering and scam activity on messaging platforms are predicted to persist, with Telegram and similar channels remaining hotbeds for fraud attempts. Crypto and fintech users should remain vigilant for new scams and account compromise schemes. Confidence level: High, given the volume and diversity of recent incidents and ongoing external news about AI, ransomware, and deepfake threats.
